subject: Critical Thinking
title: Bot Networks: Fake People, Real Influence
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Bot Networks: Fake People, Real Influence.

hook.text: A trending hashtag with 50,000 tweets looks like grassroots outrage.

buildup.text: Bot networks: coordinated fake accounts that amplify messages, create illusions of consensus, & manipulate trending.

discovery.text: Studies estimate 5-15% of Twitter/X accounts are bots. During elections and crises, they spike dramatically.

twist.text: Bots don't need to convince you directly.

climax.text: Detection signals: new accounts, no personal photos, posting at inhuman speeds, identical talking points, & suspicious.

punchline.text: If a million accounts agree, ask how many are real people.

quiz.question: How do bot networks influence public opinion?
options: By creating the illusion of mass agreement to trigger bandwagon effects
